name: Spencer Lillian
title: Aspiring Software Developer
summary: Aspiring software developer with hands-on experience in robotics, coding education, and customer-facing leadership. Proven adaptability across diverse environments—from clinical automation with Diligent Robotics to Java/Python mentorship and customer service supervision. Strong foundation in object-oriented programming, agile methodologies, and data-driven projects, with a passion for continual learning and creative problem-solving. Actively pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science with recent exposure to AI/ML, Java, and Springboot development.

experience.title: Clinical Robot Technician (CRA)
description: Assist four clinical delivery robots in a hospital setting by providing technical and physical troubleshooting.
Monitor robotic performance and ensure successful task execution in a live healthcare environment.
Conduct on-the-spot diagnostics and collaborate with engineering teams to escalate issues.

experience.title: Python/Java Mentor
description: Mentored students aged 8–15 in Python and Java programming using structured curriculum and self-paced learning.
Provided individual support on coding challenges, debugging, and conceptual understanding.
Fostered a positive and engaging learning environment tailored to varying skill levels.

experience.title: Deck Manager / Swim Instructor
description: Taught swimming lessons and supervised swim instructors to maintain quality and safety.
Certified as a lifeguard to ensure compliance and emergency readiness.
Balanced instructor coaching with hands-on class management.

experience.title: Customer Service Supervisor
description: Supervised customer service team and served as escalation point for issue resolution.
Managed customer financing inquiries and logistics for delivery or product issues.
Progressed from cashier to supervisor through consistent performance and leadership.

projects.title: AI/ML Capstone – MTG Tournament Guesser
projects.description: Designed a predictive model using Random Forest AI and Gaussian Optimization to forecast tournament winners based on Magic: The Gathering Commander deck data. Utilized PostgreSQL for data storage and SMILE ML libraries for implementation. Despite unsuccessful results, gained insight into data-driven model limitations and the importance of holistic data collection.
